txt.en:
'Listen well, maggot! I'm charged with feeding our forces, and though I'd have no problems throwing good for nothing sluggards like you on a spit to serve for dinner, the war-masters have other plans.

'So I give you a task that you'll complete, or I'll go about changing the minds of those who can cover up their trails better than I, and you will be dinner.

'The rat-folk in the south grow food, and we steal it to keep our army full and happy. Now listen well! Men, Elves, dwarves, and even the rat-folk that stalk through the Ettenmoors can be carrying the foodstuffs we need. If you find any bring it to me...or there'll be no dinner!'
'It's not meat, but it tastes better than the mash we mince from slug-meat.\n\n'We'll eat well tonight!'
'Get out there and get us some food!'

Rat-folk living on the banks of the Hoardale, south of Dâr-gazag, are not only a succulent meal, but they are a source of replenishible food. The rat-folk are farmers, supplying the enemy forces with foodstuffs. Foodstuffs can be stolen and eaten by your army as well.
Return to Taskmaster Gukthor at Dâr-gazag
Rations are portioned to enemy forces and found in locations where they hold power.\n\nTaskmaster Gukthor charged you collecting food for Angmar's Army.
